div2.head: Refined Message Information Models
div2.p: Refined Message Information Models (R-MIMs) are used to express the information content for one or more HMDs that originate from the root class identified by the Entry Point in the R-MIM. Each R-MIM is a subset of the D-MIM and contains only those classes, attributes and associations required to compose the set of messages derived from the HMDs that originate from the R-MIM root class. Classes, attributes and associations that are not required for those HMDs are eliminated and the generalization hierarchies are also collapsed.
Each CMET has an associated R-MIM and these can be seen in the CMET chapter which defines all currently used CMETs

The R-MIM diagrams use the same conventions and notions that are used in the D-MIM diagrams. Please refer to that chapter for specific information about how to read these diagrams. There is however an additional level of documentation available for R-MIMs. An R-MIM now has clickable hyperlinks on each class in the R-MIM which link to a table view. This provides an easy way to reference any additional documentation which has been provided in the table view.
